WorkItem.ClosedComment: Adjusted the default gemming templates for next version. Should be much better.
WorkItem.Description:
The latest version seems to have some strange templates.  Having 20 haste gems and haste/stam gems I would have though a little strange.    Maybe possibly at the extreme BiS where you are ArPen & Crit capped I suppose, but then those templates still have Agi gems or ArPen gems as well.   I would have thought you would use: -
 
1) ArP, ArP, ArP
2) ArP, Agi/Hit, ArP/Sta
3) ArP, Agi/Crit, ArP/Sta
4) ArP, Agi/Haste, ArP/Sta
5) Agi, Agi, Agi
6) Agi, Agi/Hit, Agi/Sta
7) Agi, Agi/Crit, Agi/Sta
8) Agi, Agi/Haste, Agi/Sta
 
Also, perhaps with templates replacing the Agi/Stam & ArPen/Stam with Nightmare Tears.   Oh, and maybe Str templates for when crit & ArPen capped - although I myself would stick with the above and just mark the Str, Str/Hit, Str/Crit, Str/Haste as available in the menus if I was close to getting capped on Crit & ArPen (still a way to go yet) - oh and the Nightmare Tear.
 
I may be wrong in this as it has been some time since I played around with absolute BiS, but certainly for my gear level, the new templates are a bit strange.

Comments.Message:
1) These "new templates" have been around for several versions. I wrote them at least a couple of months ago, if not longer, under Astry's direction.
2) STR? What? When would a Cat ever want to gem STR over AGI?
3) Yes, the Haste is for near BiS toons that are hitting both ArP and Crit Caps. That's normal behavior.
4) There are a whole bunch of Nightmare Tear templates mixed in there

1)  I only noticed this version.  Certainly the most recent previous version didn't, but then it came out with the very old gemming templates & filters for some reason
2)  Str would only ever be if you are ArPen & Crit capped.   Even then I haven't really looked heavily into those cases
3)  I know haste is very good, but I still was surprised to see straight Haste gems rather than Agi/Haste
4) Yep, wasn't questioning this.

As it stands, the templates there are perhaps correct if you are close to BiS and have crit & ArPen caps covered.  If you don't then in most cases, then Agi/Haste gem will be better than the straight Haste gem.   Same with the blue gem using Haste/Stam instead of Agi/Stam or ArPen Stam.    I would think that  for the bulk of RawrKitty users the current gemming templates are not ideal.

All in all, it is a small issue as I always use the Optimiser & Upgrade Lists, just something I noticed that to me didn't seem quite right.
I don't get it. The ones that are ideal are still there, right?

There are no Agi/Haste gems in any of the current templates and it is certainly the "go to" yellow/orange gem at my gear level - mainly 10  ICC + some 25man (no hard modes).    I'm not yet ArPen/Crit or Hit capped.

Don't want to be annoying, but I really think that the straight Haste gems in the templates should really be Agi/Haste gems.   I haven't seen a profile yet where the Agi/Haste wasn't the better DPS gem.
